alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hyde, southeastern Dare and northeastern Carteret Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout near Cedar Island Ferry Terminal, or near Cedar Island, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Frisco, Cedar Island, Buxton, Portsmouth Village, Ocracoke Light House, Cedar Island Ferry Terminal, Hatteras Ferry Terminal, Ocracoke Ferry Terminal, Ocracoke Lighthouse and Cape Hatteras Lighthouse. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island
